title: @RiotRepertoir Any plans for an AD/Armor item?
body: Title speaks for itself. I really like the new bruiser, or "juggernaut" items, but their still is one item missing and that is an AD/Armor item. Any plans in the making?

replies.body: None that I know of, I think AD health is meant to be the hybrid ad build and you can compliment that with a pure armor or armor/HP item.

Why isn't this allowed though? AP champions can build both armor/magic resist with their damage

Why can't bruisers?

I don't know if this is the exact reason that the systems designers aren't doing this now but I think that an AD/Armor item or any AD/Resist item benefits high ad damage carries like marksmen, assassins, and melee carries much more than it would the tanky bruiser types. The reason that I think that would be true is that for a high AD character with lifesteal, resistances provide a much more gold efficient path to effective heath.

which is why every single adc builds {{item:3156}}  right?

I get the theory, but until you rework ad items (and crit in general) adc's are just gonna go for the most optimal dps output and ignore most else unless they are against a really ap/ad heavy team comp.

Fair enough, but why can't you make an AD/armor item like Titanic Hydra? The passive scales with tank stats meaning that it'd benefit fighters more than carries or assassins

Hydra was the perfect opportunity to add an ad/armor item, we already have black cleaver/frozen mallet/sterak's for ad/health
Dead Man's Plate is probably your best bet.
thats not a true AD/Armor item though. thats hp and armor. Like we have the {{item:3156}}, why not a AD/Armor variant.
Seeing as it at least gives you _some_ damage for autoing with it, it's probably as close as you're going to get.

I think Atma's Impaler was the closest I've EVER seen to an AD Armor Item.

Another thing I'm curious about if anyone has any thoughts on it. Why is tenacity so hard to find/buy when merc treads have it and are so easy to buy? It just seems like tenacity is exceptionally rare... With one exceedingly prevalent exception (being merc treads.)
